full_text.full_text:
Naïve Bayes vs. Bayesian Network
▪ Naïve Bayes
– The target class Y is at the root of a tree
– Every attribute Xi is directly connected to Y
– Y is a factor behind the generation of attributes
– Can be viewed as special type of Bayesian network
▪ Bayesian network
– The target class Y is not required to be at the root of 
a tree but can appear anywhere in the graph
– Y influence X3 and X4, while influenced by X1 and X2
– Provide a more generic structure of probabilistic 
relationship
36
